metadata.feature_description: Main analytics dashboard showing overall community metrics including user engagement, content creation, and activity trends

steps.expected: Dashboard menu should expand showing submenu options
steps.actual: Dashboard menu expanded correctly showing Site Analytics and Community Analytics options

steps.action: Click on Community Analytics submenu item
steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard should load and display metrics
steps.actual: Dashboard panel opens but content fails to load. JavaScript error in console: TypeError: utility.serializeCustomDate is not a function at dashboardClass.init (social-dashboard-combined-instance.js:1025:39)

steps.expected: Dashboard content should appear with metrics, charts, and time period selectors
steps.actual: Dashboard content area remains completely blank/empty. The JavaScript error prevents any UI from rendering.

issues: Critical JavaScript Error: TypeError: utility.serializeCustomDate is not a function
Error occurs in social-dashboard-combined-instance.js at line 1025
The utility.serializeCustomDate function is called during dashboard initialization but does not exist
This error completely prevents the Community Analytics dashboard from loading
All dashboard functionality is inaccessible due to this bug

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View dashboard with different time periods (daily, weekly, monthly, yearly)

steps.action: Attempt to access time period selectors on dashboard
steps.expected: Time period options (Day, Week, Month, Year) should be visible and selectable
steps.actual: Cannot test - Community Analytics dashboard fails to load due to JavaScript error

issues: Test cannot be performed because the dashboard does not load
Blocking issue: TypeError: utility.serializeCustomDate is not a function

steps.actual: Cannot test - Community Analytics dashboard fails to load due to JavaScript error

issues: Test cannot be performed because the dashboard does not load

steps.actual: Cannot test - Community Analytics dashboard fails to load due to JavaScript error. The error occurs during initialization before any data loading attempt.

issues: Test cannot be performed because the dashboard does not load

steps.expected: Dashboard should refresh and update with new data when triggered
steps.actual: Cannot test - Community Analytics dashboard fails to load due to JavaScript error

issues: Test cannot be performed because the dashboard does not load

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test responsive layout on different screen sizes

steps.action: Attempt to test responsive behavior of dashboard
steps.expected: Dashboard should adapt layout appropriately for different screen sizes
steps.actual: Cannot test - Community Analytics dashboard fails to load due to JavaScript error. No content is rendered to test responsiveness.

issues: Test cannot be performed because the dashboard does not load
Blocking issue: TypeError: utility.serializeCustomDate is not a function

observations: The Community Analytics menu item exists and is accessible under PersonaBar > Dashboard > Community Analytics

Code review shows the feature has comprehensive functionality including: time period selection (Year, Month, Week, Day, Custom), dashboard metrics (bounceRate, totalPageViews, totalSessions, totalVisits), charts (Page Views, Channels donut chart, Devices donut chart), and comparison features
The JavaScript error occurs in social-dashboard-combined-instance.js at line 1025 during the init() function call
The error message 'utility.serializeCustomDate is not a function' indicates that the utility object passed to the dashboard does not contain the expected serializeCustomDate method
This appears to be a dependency injection or module loading issue where the utility module is not properly configured
The Site Analytics feature under the same Dashboard menu works correctly and displays its panel
The bug may be related to differences in how Site Analytics vs Community Analytics initialize their utility dependencies
